reviews.text:
What a beautiful play space, clearly curated with love and attention to detail. Loads of lovely sensory toys for babies, and various play areas and themes for older toddlers and children. Quality toys and a beautiful selection of both French and English books with several cute reading nooks that include adult size chairs for if your little one wants you to get involved and you don't want to be sat on the floor!

Had a lovely coffee and some baked goods from the cafe. Unicorn cookies were a must for our daughter - they were both gorgeous and delicious. Seating is arranged to have a view of the whole room and little ones can wander over with toys if they want to show you something.

Both our 18 month old and 3.5 year old had a fabulous time. We'll definitely be back and be recommending to friends. Service was so welcoming, friendly and yet relaxed and the place is SPOTLESSLY clean! Highly recommend!

Son LOVED it.  It was a beautiful place, and had tons of options for toys and activities. The cafe was lovely too and had plenty of choices for myself and the little one. Definitely will go again and will recommend to others! It's a great, safe place to let kids socialize and enjoy themselves while having a cup of coffee with friends üëç

Such a wonderful little playcafe! I was pleasantly surprised to see how clean and nice it was. They have lots of different toys and books to discover, i went with a baby, a toddler and a 6 year old and all of them had a great time. The pastries and cakes at the cafe were very nice and the hot chocolate we had was quite big. The 2 ladies on site were very helpful, smiley and welcoming. It was also easy to park on the streets around. My only suggestion to improve is the fact that the entrance is very small and it was a bit stressful coming in and out as we had to carry our big pram and put the shoes on/off and it was a bit difficult. Some buggies were left outside in the street as there was no more space inside which i wouldnt have liked. Apart from that, it is a wonderful place to go with children and a great way to spend the day.

We had a lovely time here, my daughter loved playing with all the toys and even made friends with the other parents and children. I loved the cosy atmosphere with the lights draped in ivy, the mural of wild animals. There was a good variety of toys, mostly wooden and we enjoyed the bilingual book area. We also had some hot drinks and my little one absolutely loved her baby chocolate. It‚Äôs also easy to get to from where I live.

I had the pleasure of visiting Dreami Play Cafe recently, and I must say it's a real treasure for families.
It offers a fabulous space for children to socialize and have a fantastic time meeting new friends.

The selection of food available is great, catering to both kids and adults.

This place is truly a much-needed asset to the area, providing a wonderful opportunity for parents and caregivers to meet up while the kids enjoy their playtime with their little friends.

The owner is incredibly engaging and always ready to assist, creating a safe and welcoming environment for all visitors.

My little one absolutely loves the play areas; they're completely hooked and have a blast every time we visit.

Dreami Play Cafe is a fantastic addition to the community, and I highly recommend it for families looking for a fun and safe place for their children to play and socialize.

address: Oakwood House, 422 Hackney Rd, London E2 7SY, United Kingdom
